title: Increases funding available for the Brooklyn healthworks pilot program and upstate healthworks
summary: Increases funding available for the Brooklyn healthworks pilot program and upstate healthworks pilot program.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

           S. 1855                                                  A. 2093

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                             S E N A T E - A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 13, 2011
                                      ___________

       IN  SENATE  --  Introduced  by  Sens. MONTGOMERY, GOLDEN, PARKER -- read
         twice and ordered printed, and when printed to  be  committed  to  the
         Committee on Insurance

       IN  ASSEMBLY  -- Introduced by M. of A. LENTOL -- read once and referred
         to the Committee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to funding of the  Brook-
         lyn healthworks pilot program and upstate healthworks pilot program

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subsection (t) of section 4327 of  the  insurance  law,  as
    2  added by chapter 441 of the laws of 2006, is amended to read as follows:
    3    (t)  Brooklyn  healthworks pilot program and upstate healthworks pilot
    4  program. Commencing on July first, two thousand six, the  superintendent
    5  shall  access  funding  from  the  small employer stop loss fund and the
    6  qualifying individual stop loss fund for  the  purpose  of  support  and
    7  expansion of the existing pilot program Brooklyn healthworks approved by
    8  the  superintendent  and  for the establishment and operation of a pilot
    9  program to be located in upstate New  York.  For  the  purpose  of  this
   10  subsection,  [in  no  event shall] the amount of funding available SHALL
   11  NOT exceed [two] FOUR percent of the  annual  funding  amounts  for  the
   12  small  employer  stop  loss fund and the qualifying individual stop loss
   13  fund.
   14    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01545-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to funding of the Brooklyn healthworks pilot program and upstate healthworks pilot program
